Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly of type A; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of hoplite to left (helmeted head with traces of added red dots on crest, round shield with red dots around rim, shoulder and part of raised spear remaining); row of dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 38)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 363, no. B480)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1435) (phase 3)
